intro: Whitfieldia seretii var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic whitfieldia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
